name: index
description: The official (default) index of modules for CFEngine Build

allow-all-hosts.description: Allows all hosts / IP addresses to connect and fetch policy.

allow-hosts.description: Allows specific hosts (by IP / subnet) to connect and fetch policy.

input.label: Allowed hosts
input.while: Do you want to specify more IPs / subnets?

cfengine-supported.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the support status for the current version of CFEngine.

client-initiated-reporting.description: Enables client initiated reporting and disable pull collection.

compliance-report-imports.name: compliance-report-imports
compliance-report-imports.description: Used by other modules to import compliance reports to Mission Portal.

compliance-report-os-is-vendor-supported.name: compliance-report-os-is-vendor-supported
compliance-report-os-is-vendor-supported.description: Compliance report definition for checking if the current OS version is supported by the vendor.

conditional-installer.description: Allows you to specify packages you want installed and conditions for where you want them installed, as well as a list of packages you generally want uninstalled.

input.label: Uninstall
input.question: Which package(s) would you like to be uninstalled?

input.label: Install
input.while: Do you want to specify more packages to be installed?

cron-access.description: Limits access to cron-related files in /etc by setting user, group, and permission bits.

cve-2021-3156-sudo.description: Reporting data (inventory) and remediaton for CVE-2021-3156, a heap overflow in sudo that allows privilege escalation.

cve-2021-44228-log4j.description: Leverages yahoo/check-log4j to scan for files potentially vulnerable to CVE-2021-44228, which allows arbitrary code execution.

default-encrypt-method-sha512.description: Sets the default password hashing algorithm to SHA-512 (encrypt_method in the /etc/login.defs file).

delete-files.description: Allows you to specify a list of files you want deleted on hosts in your infrastructure. When this module is deployed as part of your policy set, every time CFEngine runs, it will check if those files exist, and delete them if they do.

input.label: Files

subtype.label: Why
subtype.question: Why should this file be deleted?

input.while: Specify another file you want deleted on your hosts?

delete-home-dotrhosts.description: Ensures that ~/.rhosts files are not present, as they present a security risk.

delete-home-dotshosts.description: Ensures that ~/.shosts files are not present, as they present a security risk.

demo.description: Enables convenient and insecure settings for demoing CFEngine.

disable-recommendations.description: Disable all recommendations emitted from the Masterfiles Policy Framework (MPF).

disable-automatic-key-trust.description: Makes the hub / policy server stop accepting new keys automatically.

enable-aslr.description: Ensures that Address space layout randomization (ASLR) is enabled on the system.

etc-issue-access.description: Limits access to the /etc/issue file by setting user, group, and permission bits.

etc-issue-content.description: Manages the content of /etc/issue and provides limited inventory of it's content.

input.label: Text
input.question: What is the content that should be in /etc/issue?

etc-motd-access.description: Limits access to the /etc/motd file by setting user, group, and permission bits.

every-minute.description: Makes policy fetching, evaluation, and reporting happen every minute.

file-permissions.description: Manages file permissions, allowing you to specify permission bits for different paths.

install-aide.description: Ensures the AIDE (Advanced Intrusion Detection Environment) software is installed.

inventory-clamav.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for useful information from ClamAV (version, definitions version, definitions date).

inventory-etc-hosts.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for entries from the /etc/hosts file.

inventory-etc-login-defs.name: inventory-etc-login-defs
inventory-etc-login-defs.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for useful bits from the /etc/login.defs file.

inventory-fips-mode-setup.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the status of fips-mode-setup.

inventory-kernel-boot-params.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for kernel parameters set during system boot.

inventory-kernel-settings-sysctl-conf.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for settings from the /etc/sysctl.conf file.

inventory-kernel-settings-sysctl-current.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for sysctl settings current state.

inventory-lastlog.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for users who have logged in and when.

inventory-local-groups.name: inventory-local-groups
inventory-local-groups.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the local groups on the system.

inventory-local-users.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the local users on the system with their attributes.

inventory-local-users-locked.name: inventory-local-users-locked
inventory-local-users-locked.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the local users on the system that are locked.

inventory-local-users-non-root-has-uid-0.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the non-root users that have uid 0.

inventory-local-users-password-empty.name: inventory-local-users-password-empty
inventory-local-users-password-empty.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the local users on the system that do not have a password set.

inventory-local-users-password-hashing-a.name: inventory-local-users-password-hashing-algorithm
inventory-local-users-password-hashing-a.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for password hashing algorithms in use by local users.

inventory-openssl-versions.description: Adds an inventory attribute containing all versions of OpenSSL found on the system.

inventory-ssh-host-key-fingerprints.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for the SSH host key fingerprints.

inventory-sudoers.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for users with sudo access.

inventory-systemd.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) for interesting things from systemd.

inventory-unshadowed-users.description: Adds reporting data (inventory) on local users in /etc/passwd not using /etc/shadow for their password.

inventory-writable-directories-in-root-p.description: Reporting data (inventory) directories in root's $PATH that are world or group writable.

inventory-yum-update-info.description: Adds information about security updates from 'yum updateinfo' to inventory.

library-for-promise-types-in-bash.description: Library enabling promise types implemented in bash.

library-for-promise-types-in-python.description: Library enabling promise types implemented in python.

library-parsed-local-groups.name: library-parsed-local-groups
library-parsed-local-groups.description: Parses local group from the /etc/group file on the system.

library-parsed-local-users.name: library-parsed-local-users
library-parsed-local-users.description: Parses local users from /etc/passwd on the system with their attributes from /etc/shadow.

library-sshd-config.description: Library used by other modules to manage sshd configuration.

lynis.description: Automates the installation, running, and reporting of CISOfy's lynis system audits.

input.label: Lynis version
input.question: What version of Lynis should be used?

input.label: Tarball url
input.question: Where should clients download lynis from (http/https)
input.comment: Some may want to self host the tarball within their own infrastructure. This provides an easy way to do that. Note, the archive should be named for the version of Lynis selected.

input.label: Hash of the tarball
input.question: What is the hash of the tarball?

input.label: Hash type to verify
input.question: What hashing algorithm should be used to verify the Lynis script?

maintainers-in-motd.description: Add maintainer and purpose information from CMDB to /etc/motd

migrate2rocky.description: Unattended migration of CentOS 8 hosts to Rocky Linux.

ntp-maxpoll.description: Ensures that maxpoll is configured (to 10 by default).

packages-allowlist.description: Reports on and optionally removes software installed by the platforms default package module (e.g. yum, apt_get) that is not in an explicit allow list.

input.label: Uninstall not allowed packages (disabled|enabled)
input.question: Would you like to enable enforcement for packages-allowlist? (disabled|enabled)

input.label: Packages

subtype.label: Package name
subtype.question: What package name would you like to allow?

input.while: Do you want to allow another package?

packages-allowlist-snapshot.description: Allows you to snapshot which packages are installed on a system, and then enforce that list, uninstalling or giving warnings when other packages appear.

input.label: Mode
input.question: What mode should the module be in? (init|warn|enforce)

package-method-winget.description: Package method for Windows winget package manager.

input.label: Accept Source Agreements
input.question: Would you like to accept source agreements for winget packages promises? [yes|no]

input.label: Accept Package Agreements
input.question: Would you like to accept package agreements for winget packages promises? [yes|no]

input.label: Allow necessary PowerShell Execution Policy change: LocalMachine set to Unrestricted in order to install winget and cmdlets
input.question: Would you like to allow this module to change PowerShell Execution Policy to LocalMachine:Unrestricted? [yes|no]

powershell-execution-policy.description: Inventory and bundle for PowerShell Execution Policy

promise-type-ansible.description: Promise type to run ansible playbooks.

promise-type-docker-compose.description: Promise type to manage containers using docker compose

promise-type-git.description: Promise type to manage git repos.

promise-type-groups.description: Experimental promise type to manage local user groups.

promise-type-http.description: Promise type to perform HTTP(S) requests from policy.

promise-type-systemd.description: Promise type to manage systemd services.

root-path-enforce-permissions.description: Enforces that directories in root's $PATH are not world or group writable.

ssh-ciphers-strong.description: Ensures that the SSH daemon uses strong ciphers.

ssh-max-auth-tries.description: Limits the maximum authentication attempts (default to 3).

ssh-permit-empty-passwords-no.description: Ensures that PermitEmptyPasswords is set to no in the sshd configuration.

ssh-permit-root-login-no.description: Ensures that the SSH daemon does not permit logging in as root.

ssh-protocol-2.description: Ensures that the SSH daemon uses SSH protocol 2.

stig-rhel-7.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide

input.label: Mode
input.question: What mode should the module be in? (warn|enforce)

input.label: Enabled
input.question: Under which context should this module be enabled?

input.label: Exceptions

subtype.label: Finding ID
subtype.question: Which finding would you like to add an exception for (e.g.: V-204443)

subtype.label: Context
subtype.question: Under what context should this be an exception?

input.while: Do you want to add another exception?

sudo-enforce-allowed-users.description: Ensures the following lines 'ALL ALL=(ALL) ALL' and 'ALL ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL' are not present in the /etc/sudoers.conf file.

sudo-requires-passwords.description: Ensures that sudo requires password (there are no 'NOPASSWD' in the /etc/sudoers file).

surf-cfengine-library.description: SURF CFEngine Library (SCL) for building services with json/mustache.

tmp-file-age.description: Reporting data (inventory) and removal of old files in the /tmp directory.

tmp-nosuid.description: Makes sure /tmp is mounted with the 'nosuid' option.

uninstall-apache.description: Ensures the apache package is not installed.

uninstall-bind.description: Ensures the bind package is not installed.

uninstall-dhcp.description: Ensures the dhcp package is not installed.

uninstall-dovecot.description: Ensures the dovecot package is not installed.

uninstall-ftp.description: Ensures the ftp server package is not installed on the system(s).

uninstall-openldap-server.description: Ensures the openldap server package is not installed on the system(s).

uninstall-packages.description: Uninstalls a list of packages specified by module input.

input.label: Packages to uninstall

subtype.label: Name
subtype.question: What is the name in the package manager (apt, yum, etc.)?

subtype.label: Why
subtype.question: Why should this package be uninstalled?

input.while: Specify another package you want uninstalled on your hosts?

uninstall-rsh-server.description: Ensure the remote shell (rsh) server package is not installed on the system(s).

uninstall-samba.description: Ensures the samba package is not installed.

uninstall-squid.description: Ensures the squid package is not installed.

uninstall-talk.description: Ensures the talk client and server packages are not installed.

uninstall-telnet-server.description: Ensures the telnet server package is not installed on the system.

uninstall-xinetd.description: Ensures the xinetd package is not installed.

upgrade-all-packages.description: Ensures that the package manager data is updated and all upgradeable packages are upgraded.

windows-optional-feature.description: Manage and inventory Windows Optional Features.
